member.name: T:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod
member.summary: Represents the types of HTTP protocol methods that can be used with a REST request.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.GET
member.summary: Represents an HTTP GET protocol method.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.POST
member.summary: Represents an HTTP POST protocol method that is used to post a new entity as an addition to a URI.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.PUT
member.summary: Represents an HTTP PUT protocol method that is used to replace an entity identified by a URI.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.DELETE
member.summary: Represents an HTTP DELETE protocol method.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.HEAD
F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.PATCH
member.summary: Represents an HTTP PATCH protocol method.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.OPTIONS
member.summary: Represents an HTTP OPTIONS protocol method.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.TRACE
member.summary: Represents an HTTP TRACE protocol method.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.CONNECT
member.summary: Represents the HTTP CONNECT protocol method that is used with a proxy that can dynamically switch to tunneling, as in the case of SSL tunneling.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.COPY
member.summary: Represents an HTTP COPY protocol method.

member.name: F:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.HttpMethod.MOVE
member.summary: Represents an HTTP MOVE protocol method.

member.name: T:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.IRestService
member.summary: Represents a service for executing generic REST requests.
Executes a REST request with a string and strongly-typed result.
member.param: The base URI.
The HTTP method to use for the request.
The body of the request. This parameter is optional. If the value is null, the request is sent without a body.
A collection of custom HTTP headers to include with the request. This parameter is optional. If the value is null, no custom headers are added to the HTTP request.
A collection of parameters to add to the query string portion of the request URI. This parameter is optional. If the value is null, no parameters are added to the query string.
The settings to use for the request. This parameters is optional. If the value is null, an implementation-specific set of default settings will be used for the request.
member.typeparam: The type of the data returned in the REST response.
member.returns: Returns a object containing the HTTP status code, headers, body, and strongly-typed data from the REST response.
member.exception: If is null.
If is not a valid base URI.
If is not supported by the service.
If the body of the response could not be deserialized to an object of type .

member.name: T:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestRetryLogic
member.summary: Provides a simple default implementation of for HTTP REST requests.

member.name: M:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestRetryLogic.Execute(System.Func{JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.Response},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Net.HttpStatusCode},System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Executes a user-defined operation with the specified "success" values, number of retry attempts if a failure occurs, and delay time between retry attempts.
member.param: The user-defined operation to execute.
A collection of values which are generally considered failures, but should be treated as success values for this call.
The number of times to retry a failed operation. This parameter is optional. The default value is 1.
The delay between retry operations. This parameter is optional. If the value is null, the default is (no delay).
member.returns: Returns the result of a successful execution of . If failed and the maximum number of retries has been reached, the method returns the last (unsuccessful) result returned by .
member.exception: If is null.

If is less than zero.
-or-
If is less than .

member.name: T:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings
member.summary: Specifies the settings for an HTTP REST request.

member.name: M:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default values.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.Accept
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP Accept header, which specifies the MIME types that are acceptable for the response. If this value is null, the Accept header is omitted from the request.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.AllowZeroContentLength
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not 0 is a valid value for the Content-Length HTTP header for this request.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.ChunkRequest
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to send data in segments to the Internet resource.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.ConnectionLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections allowed on the object used for the request. If the value is null, the connection limit value for the object is not altered.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.ContentLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the Content-Length HTTP header.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the Content-Type HTTP header. If this value is null, the Content-Type header is omitted from the request.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.Credentials
member.summary: Gets or sets the credentials to use for this request. This value can be null if credentials are not specified.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.ExtendedLoggingData
member.summary: Gets or sets a user-defined collection to pass as the final argument to the callback method.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.Non200SuccessCodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of HTTP status codes greater than or equal to 300 which should be considered a successful result for this request. A value of null is allowed, and should be treated as an empty collection.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.ResponseActions
member.summary: Gets or sets a map of user-defined actions to execute in response to specific HTTP status codes. A value of null is allowed, and should be treated as an empty collection.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.RetryCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times this request should be retried if it fails.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.RetryDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay before retrying a failed request.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the request timeout.

member.name: P:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.RequestSettings.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the User-Agent HTTP header. If this value is null, the User-Agent header is omitted from the request.

member.name: T:JSIStudios.SimpleRESTServices.Client.Response
member.summary: Represents the basic response of an HTTP REST request, where the body of the response is stored as a text string.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given HTTP status code, headers, and raw body.
member.param: The HTTP status code.
A collection of all HTTP headers included with this response.
The raw body of this HTTP response as a text string. When included in the response, this value should be loaded with the encoding specified in the Content-Encoding and/or Content-Type HTTP headers.

member.summary: Executes a user-defined operation with the specified "success" values, number of retry attempts if a failure occurs, and delay time between retry attempts.
member.param: The user-defined operation to execute.
A collection of values which are generally considered failures, but should be treated as success values for this call.
The number of times to retry a failed operation. This parameter is optional. The default value is 1.
The delay between retry operations. This parameter is optional. If the value is null, the default is (no delay).
member.returns: Returns the result of a successful execution of . If failed and the maximum number of retries has been reached, the method returns the last (unsuccessful) result returned by .
